user.title: Google Find My Device Authentication
user.description: Choose your authentication method. Method 1 is recommended if you can run GoogleFindMyTools on a computer with Chrome.

secrets_json.title: Method 1: GoogleFindMyTools secrets.json
secrets_json.description: Run GoogleFindMyTools (Chrome) to generate authentication tokens, then paste the full contents of the Auth/secrets.json file below.

individual_tokens.title: Method 2: Individual OAuth Token
individual_tokens.description: Enter your OAuth token and Google email address obtained from a manual authentication process.

device_selection.title: Polling Settings
device_selection.description:
Newly discovered devices appear disabled and can be enabled in device settings. Configure the general polling parameters:
• Location poll interval: How often to start a new polling cycle (60–3600 seconds)
• Device poll delay: Delay between individual device polls within a cycle (1–60 seconds)

Google Home filter: Enabled by default with keywords nest/google/home/mini/hub/display/chromecast/speaker. Matches substitute Home zone coordinates for Google/Nest/Chromecast detections and debounce repeated "home" updates for 15 minutes. Adjust the keywords here if your devices use different names.

select_hub_for_visibility.title: Select hub
select_hub_for_visibility.description: Choose which Google Find My hub to manage before opening the device visibility dialog.

reconfigure.title: Reconfigure Google Find My Device
reconfigure.description: Review the current configuration for **{email}**. Continue to update credentials or adjust polling options.

reauth_confirm.title: Reauthenticate
reauth_confirm.description:
Your credentials for **{email}** appear to be invalid or expired. Provide new credentials below.

You can either paste the full contents of a fresh **secrets.json** **or** enter a new **OAuth token**.

Note: The account email is fixed for this reauthentication and cannot be changed here.

migrate_complete.title: Migration complete
migrate_complete.description: Google Find My Device for **{email}** has been migrated to the new feature group structure. Review your devices and reload the integration if any entities remain offline.

init.title: Configuration
init.description: What would you like to configure?

credentials.title: Update Credentials (optional)
credentials.description:
Update credentials without exposing existing values. Provide exactly one method:

• Paste full contents of a new **secrets.json**
**or**
• Enter a new **OAuth token** and **Google email**.

If provided, credentials will be validated and stored; the integration will reload without changing your entity names.

data_description.subentry: Apply credential updates to the selected feature group. Review the [Subentries and feature groups](https://github.com/BSkando/GoogleFindMy-HA/blob/main/README.md#subentries-and-feature-groups) guide for workflow details.

settings.title: Options
settings.description:
Adjust location settings:
• Location poll interval: How often to poll for locations (60–3600 seconds)
• Device poll delay: Delay between device polls (1–60 seconds)
• Minimum accuracy: Ignore locations with an accuracy worse than this value (25–500 meters)
• Movement threshold: Minimum movement required to trigger a location update (10–200 meters)

Google Home Filter:
• Enable to associate detections from Google Home devices with the Home zone
• Keywords support partial matching (comma-separated)
• Example: “nest” matches “Kitchen Nest Mini”

data_description.delete_caches_on_remove: Remove cached tokens and device metadata when this entry is deleted.
data_description.map_view_token_expiration: When enabled, map view tokens expire after 1 week. When disabled (default), tokens do not expire.
data_description.contributor_mode: Choose how your device contributes to Google's network (High-traffic areas by default, or All areas for crowdsourced reporting).
data_description.subentry: Store these options on the selected feature group. See [Subentries and feature groups](https://github.com/BSkando/GoogleFindMy-HA/blob/main/README.md#subentries-and-feature-groups) for examples.

visibility.title: Device Visibility
visibility.description: Restore previously ignored devices to make them visible again. Select one or more devices to restore and save.

data_description.subentry: Restored devices join the feature group you choose. See [Subentries and feature groups](https://github.com/BSkando/GoogleFindMy-HA/blob/main/README.md#subentries-and-feature-groups) for assignment guidance.

repairs.description: Choose a repair action for your feature groups.

repairs_move.title: Move devices between subentries
repairs_move.description: Move devices into a selected feature group. Devices removed from other groups will continue to appear under the chosen group.

repairs_delete.title: Delete a subentry
repairs_delete.description: Delete a feature group and move its devices into another group.

multiple_config_entries.title: Multiple configuration entries detected
multiple_config_entries.description: Google Find My Device now supports multiple configuration entries, one per Google account. If each entry targets a different account, no action is required. When the same account is added twice, Home Assistant creates a **Duplicate account entries** repair issue for the new entry so you can remove or re-enable the correct one.

unique_id_collision.title: Entity unique ID collision detected
unique_id_collision.description:
Some entities for **{entry}** already use the new unique ID format and conflict with the migration.

**Count:** {count}
**Examples:** {entities}

To resolve:
1) Open **Settings → Devices & Services → Entities** and search for the listed entities.
2) Remove or rename conflicting entities, or delete abandoned entries from other integrations.
3) Reload the integration (or restart Home Assistant). The migration will retry automatically.
